questions.question_text:
Universal Containers implemented an application process that uses custom objects Internships and Applications. The organization-wide default for Internships has been set to private and is the master in the master-detail relationship with Applications. The VP of HR wants to allow edit access to Applications to recruiters.
How should an app builder configure the proper access?

choices.C: Add a sharing rule that grants the users Read/Write access to the Internship records
choices.A: Create a sharing rule that grants the users Read/Write access to the Application records
choices.B: Create a queue for the web applications and assign access to the users who will be editing the records
choices.D: Set the organization-wide default on the Applications object to Read/Write

discussion.content:
answer C.
You can't create sharing rules on detail object.
Child objects don’t have a share-record of their own and will be shared along with the master record.

Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. Remember detail will get "controlled by parent" sharing. So that should help to answer question.

Selected Answer: C
The records in a detail object cannot have any sharing rules exclusively applicable to itself. All sharing rules for a detail record are inherited from its master record. You need to create sharing rules for Object A (so Object B inherits it).

https://salesforce.stackexchange.com/questions/388943/if-object-a-is-master-and-object-b-is-detail-owd-for-object-a-is-private-can-y

Selected Answer: C
C 100%

comments.content:
That's not what that means at all, it is not a trick. It is a very normal way of describing the master-detail relationship between two objects. "Parent is the master in the master-detail relationship with Child." Since the child object can NOT have its own sharing rules separate from the parent the sharing rule must be on the Master object, in this case that is the Internships object which is the master/parent of the Application object which is the child/detail.

Source: Native Speaker of American English

discussion.content: It is a trick question -> "The organization-wide default for Internships has been set to private and is the master in the master-detail relationship with Applications." - they use WITH Applications, so Applications is Master detail too. Answer A.

Selected Answer: C
C. Add a sharing rule that grants the users Read/Write access to the Internship records
The answer is C. Details objects can't have separate sharing rules. It inherits the sharing properties of the master object.

Selected Answer: C

The reason why global action is not in use, because it cannot take fields of a related record, which user is on and presses button from.

Selected Answer: C
In Salesforce, there are two types of Quick Actions – Global and Object-specific Actions – 
Global Actions: are not related to a specific record and can be placed anywhere that actions are supported.
Object-specific Actions: are related to a particular object, eg. when you create a Contact via the Contacts related list on an Account record, the ‘Account Name’ field is populated for you.
Going by above, Option A is completely wrong as it doesn't satisfy the requirement.

Correct Answer is C - Although it says "Custom Action on Account", we already know they are talking about creating a quick action on Account. You create a custom action on Account in Set up and then add it to the Quick action layout.
